Package tools.data.img

Class ImageSheet

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.data.img.ImageSheet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoundedImageSheet
    public abstract class ImageSheet
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface for image sheets.
    An image sheet consists of a 2D sheet of images, which can be addessed via coordinates. The coordinates can be nagative, and the images returned from the get functions are allowed to be null.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description

      Denotes whether this image sheet is opaque.

    • Method Detail

      • scale

        protected static final java.awt.Image scale​(java.awt.Image img,
                                            int width,
                                            int height,
                                            int scaleHints)
        Scales the given image to the given width and heigh using the scaling hints. The width and height remain unchanged if respectivily the width and height equal -1.
        Parameters:
        img - The image to scale.
        width - The width of the resulting image, or -1 if it remains unchanged.
        height - The height of the resulting image, or -1 if it remains unchanged.
        scaleHints - The scaling hints.
        Returns:
        An image with the given width and height, and scaled using the scaling hints.

      • get

        public java.awt.Image get​(int x,
                          int y)
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the image sheet at (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the image to get.
        y - The y-coordinate of the image to get.
        Returns:
        The image at (x, y).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indices x and y are out of bounds.
        See Also:
        getSheet()

      • get

        public java.awt.Image get​(int x,
                          int y,
                          int width,
                          int height,
                          int scaleHints)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the scaled image at (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the image to get.
        y - The y-coordinate of the image to get.
        width - The width of the image to return. -1 if the default width should be used.
        height - The height of the image to return. -1 if the default height should be used.
        scaleHints - The scale hints used for scaling the image.
        Returns:
        The image sheet at (x, y) with the given width and height, and scaled using the scale hints.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given width or height are zero.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indices x and y are out of bounds.
        See Also:
        get(int, int), Image.getScaledInstance(int, int, int)

      • isOpaque

        public boolean isOpaque()
        Returns:
        true if the images are opaque. false otherwise.

      • setOpaque

        public void setOpaque​(boolean opaque)
        Sets the opacity of the image sheet.
        Parameters:
        opaque - The new opacity of the image sheet.

      • getSheet

        public abstract java.awt.Image[][] getSheet()
        Returns the underlaying source image sheet.
        This function should in general not be used as special value and exception handling cannot be done here.]
        Returns:
        The image sheet described by this object, or null if not supported.

      • canAccess

        public abstract boolean canAccess​(int x,
                                  int y)
        Returns:
        false if requesting the image at (x, y) will always result in an IndexOutOfBoundsException being thrown. true otherwise.

      • getPart

        public BoundedImageSheet getPart​(int width,
                                 int height)
        Gets a part of this image sheet.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the new image sheet (in images).
        height - The height of the new image sheet (in images).
        Returns:
        An image sheet representing a part of this image sheet.

      • getPart

        public BoundedImageSheet getPart​(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int width,
                                 int height)
        Gets a part of this image sheet.
        Parameters:
        x - The initial translation over the x-axis (in images).
        y - The initial translation over the y-axis (in images).
        width - The width of the new image sheet (in images).
        height - The height of the new image sheet (in images).
        Returns:
        An image sheet representing a part of this image sheet.

      • asGUIImageSheet

        public GUIImageSheet asGUIImageSheet​(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     int width,
                                     int height)
        Creates a GUI image sheet based on the sub-image of this image sheet.
        The created GUI sheet will only return the provided sub-sheet for all states.
        Parameters:
        x - The initial translation over the x-axis (in images).
        y - The initial translation over the y-axis (in images).
        width - The width of the new image sheet (in images).
        height - The height of the new image sheet (in images).
        Returns:
        A GUI image sheet based on the sub-image of this image sheet.

      • draw

        public boolean draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int posX,
                    int posY)
             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Draws the image at (x, y) at the given coordinates (posX, posY).
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object used to draw on.
        x - The x-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        y - The y-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        posX - The amount to translate the image in the x-axis.
        posY - The amount to translate the image in the y-axis.
        Returns:
        true if anything was drawn on the graphics object. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indices x and y are out of bounds.
        See Also:
        get(int, int)

      • draw

        public boolean draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int posX,
                    int posY,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    int scaleHints)
             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Resizes the image at (x, y) to the size (width x height) and draws it at the given coordinates (posX, posY).
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object used to draw on.
        x - The x-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        y - The y-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        posX - The amount to translate the image in the x-axis.
        posY - The amount to translate the image in the y-axis.
        width - The width of the image to draw.
        height - The height of the image to draw.
        scaleHints - The scale hints used for scaling the image.
        Returns:
        true if anything was drawn on the graphics object. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given width or height are zero.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indices x and y are out of bounds.
        See Also:
        get(int, int, int, int, int)

      • checkWidthHeight

        protected void checkWidthHeight​(int width,

        Verifies that the given width and height are non-zero.
        Parameters:
        width - The width to check.
        height - The height to check.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given width or height are zero.
